interviewer_dialogue: Hi.  This is Interviewer, the landlady.

patient_dialogue: Hi.  I have a leak that’s in my bedroom and I was supposed to have someone come and look at it about uh.. past week or a couple days ago and no one has came to check up on it.
interviewer_dialogue: Okay.  Uhm.. I’m sorry I haven’t had enough time to get over to fix it, but I’ve been very busy.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  Well, the leak has gotten much worse now that we’ve let it uh.. pass a few days.  So it’s gotten much worse.  Is there anyone that’s gonna come and look at it soon?
interviewer_dialogue: I have a list and you’re on the list, but there are other problems that are more serious.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  So uhm.. how long do you think it’ll be before you can come and fix it?
interviewer_dialogue: I’m not sure what I can do about your problem right now.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  Uhm.. well, I’ll hold off for little days, but if it gets much worser I’m gonna need to move to another apartment.  Do you have another apartment op-- available?
interviewer_dialogue: It didn’t sound that bad the last time you called.

patient_dialogue: Well, yes.  But now that it’s been neglected it’s gotten worser and worse, and if we wait any longer it’ll be much worser.
interviewer_dialogue: I have a lot of other tenants with problems that are currently ahead of yours.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  I’ll wait.  If it’s not that bad, I’ll stay on.  If it gets really worse, then I want to know if I can move to another apartment.
interviewer_dialogue: There currently aren’t any other apartments that you could move to.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  So uhm.. we’ll just see how it goes from here then and see how long it takes you to come and fix it.  If it takes longer than I think is appropriate then I’ll just go ahead and contact the- the Tenants’ Association in regards to this uh.. situation.
interviewer_dialogue: I do do all the repairs myself for the whole building.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  All right.  Well, I’ll try to work with you then, okay?
And well, let’s see if we can get to it quicker and faster.

interviewer_dialogue: It might take me about a week, maybe even two weeks before I’ll have time to fix it, but I’ll try to stop by as soon as I can.

patient_dialogue: Okay.  Just come have a look at it and see how much worser it’s gotten to see if you can wait for longer than that, okay?
